com.xhive.dom.xlink.interfaces
Interface XhiveXLinkUtilIf

public interface XhiveXLinkUtilIf

Provides convenient link processing methods. The link processing methods are:

  • Create the location URI of a node in the database. You can use this location URI in XLink as a value of the href attribute of the locator or simple linktypes.
  • Resolve the linked resources located by a URI. The resources are the result of an XPointer query. Linked resources are of class XhiveLocationIf.
  • Find all simple and extended links descending a node.
  • Find all simple and extended links descending a node and having a given node as ending resource.
  • Find all resources linked by any of the descending nodes of a given node.
(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Method Detail

generateURI

java.lang.String generateURI(Node node)
Returns a URI representing the location URI of the node. When the node is a library or document, the returned string consists of the path from the root library to the document or library. When the node is part of a document, the returned string consists of the path to the document and an XPointer expression locating the node in the document. When a node has an ID attribute, the XPointer expression is based on the ID. Otherwise the XPointer expression is based on the relative path from the document node to the node.
Node addressing requires all ancestor library and document nodes to have a name. If any of the ancestor library or document nodes does not have a name, an exception is thrown.
You can only apply this function to nodes in the current database.

Parameters:
node - the node for which you want to generate a URI.
Returns:
The String representation of the location URI of the node.

resolveLinkedResources

java.util.Iterator resolveLinkedResources(java.lang.String uri,
                                          DOMImplementation impl)
                                          throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                 org.xml.sax.SAXException
Returns an Iterator containing linked resources located by the URI.

This function can resolve both absolute paths within the database and (absolute and relative) paths in the file system.

The DOMImplementation object is used to generate the DOM representation of an XML file in the file system. This object has to be an X-Hive/DB implementation object. In X-Hive/DB, XhiveLibraryIf objects serve as DOMImplementation objects.

When the URI contains a relative path within the database, a context Node parameter is required.

Parameters:
uri - the String representation of the node.
impl - the DOMImplementation to create a DOM representation of the linked resource.
Returns:
Iterator containing linked resources of class XhiveLocationIf, located by the URI.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
See Also:
resolveLinkedResources(java.lang.String, DOMImplementation, Node)

resolveLinkedResources

java.util.Iterator resolveLinkedResources(java.lang.String uri,
                                          DOMImplementation impl,
                                          Node context)
                                          throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                 org.xml.sax.SAXException
Returns an Iterator containing linked resources located by the URI.

This function can resolve both absolute and relative paths within the database or the file system.

The DOMImplementation object is used to generate the DOM representation of an XML file in the file system. This object has to be an X-Hive/DB implementation object. In X-Hive/DB, XhiveLibraryIf objects serve as DOMImplementation objects.

The context Node is used to resolve relative paths within the database.

Parameters:
uri - the String representation of the node.
impl - the DOMImplementation to create a DOM representation of the linked resource.
context - the context of the uri or null when no context is needed
Returns:
Iterator containing linked resources of class XhiveLocationIf, located by the URI.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
See Also:
resolveLinkedResources(java.lang.String, DOMImplementation)

getLinks

java.util.Iterator getLinks(Node node)
Returns an Iterator with all simple and extended links descending node.

Parameters:
node - the node containing links.
Returns:
An Iterator with all simple and extended links descending node.

getNodesLinkingTo

java.util.Iterator getNodesLinkingTo(Node node,
                                     Node root)
Returns all nodes descending the root node linking to node. Linking nodes are of type simple link or locator.

Parameters:
node - the node to which the returned nodes are linking.
root - the root node is ancestor of all returned nodes.
Returns:
An Iterator containing all nodes descending the root node linking to node.

getResourcesLinkedBy

java.util.Iterator getResourcesLinkedBy(Node node)
Returns all nodes linked by node or one of its descendants. This function does not propagate search in linked resources. All returned nodes have node as ancestor.

Parameters:
node - the node linking the returned nodes.
Returns:
A Iterator containing all objects linked by node or one of its descendants.

expandDocument

Document expandDocument(Document document,
                        Document resultDocument,
                        boolean deep)
Returns the resultDocument that is a copy of the orignal document and has all embedded links expanded. All simple and extended links with attribute show = "embed" embed the 'linked' resources.
Only outbound arcs are expanded; resources of inbound and third-party links are not expanded.
Only DOM nodes, inside or outside the database, are expanded.
When expanding in 'deep' mode, all linked resources are expanded as well.
By default, all 'linked' resources are inserted into the 'embedded' link. If there are cyclic dependencies, an exception is thrown.
Both document and resultDocument must be X-Hive/DB implementations. The resultDocument has to consist of a document node. The document element and its descendants are removed before processing.

Parameters:
document - the document to expand.
resultDocument - the 'empty' resultDocument to which the document and the linked resources are copied.
deep - when true, all linked resources are expanded as well.
Returns:
The resultDocument in which all 'embedded' links are expanded.

expandDocument

Document expandDocument(Document document,
                        Document resultDocument,
                        boolean deep,
                        boolean replace)
                        throws XhiveException
Returns the resultDocument that is a copy of the orignal document and has all embedded links expanded. All simple and extended links with attribute show = "embed" embed the 'linked' resources.
Only outbound arcs are expanded; resources of inbound and third-party links are not expanded.
Only DOM nodes, inside or outside the database, are expanded.
When expanding in 'deep' mode, all linked resources are expanded as well.
When expanding in 'replace' mode, the 'embedded' links are replaced by their linked resources, otherwise the linked resources are inserted into the 'embedded' links.
If there are cyclic dependencies, an exception is thrown.
Both document and resultDocument must be X-Hive/DB implementations. The resultDocument has to consist of a document node. The document element and its descendants are removed before processing.

Parameters:
document - the document to expand.
resultDocument - the 'empty' resultDocument to which the document and the linked resources are copied.
deep - when true, all linked resources are expanded as well.
replace - when true>, the 'embedded' links are replaced by their linked resources. When false>, the linked resources are inserted into the 'embedded' links
Returns:
The resultDocument in which all 'embedded' links are expanded.
Throws:
XhiveException

expandDocument

Document expandDocument(Document document,
                        Document resultDocument,
                        boolean deep,
                        boolean replace,
                        DOMErrorHandler errorHandler)
                        throws XhiveException
Returns the resultDocument that is a copy of the orignal document and has all embedded links expanded. All simple and extended links with attribute show = "embed" embed the 'linked' resources.
Only outbound arcs are expanded; resources of inbound and third-party links are not expanded.
Only DOM nodes, inside or outside the database, are expanded.
When expanding in 'deep' mode, all linked resources are expanded as well.
When expanding in 'replace' mode, the 'embedded' links are replaced by their linked resources, otherwise the linked resources are inserted into the 'embedded' links.
If there are cyclic dependencies, an exception is thrown.
When errors occur during expansion, the errorhandler is called.
Both document and resultDocument must be X-Hive/DB implementations. The resultDocument has to consist of a document node. All descending nodes, including the document element, are removed before processing. The document-type node is not removed.

Parameters:
document - the document to expand.
resultDocument - the 'empty' resultDocument to which the document and the linked resources are copied.
deep - when true, all linked resources are expanded as well.
replace - when true>, the 'embedded' links are replaced by their linked resources. When false>, the linked resources are inserted into the 'embedded' links
errorHandler - an errorhandler
Returns:
The resultDocument in which all 'embedded' links are expanded.
Throws:
XhiveException
